heading: General Purpose and Sentron Molded Case Circuit Breakers
headline: Molded Case Circuit Breakers For Any Application
introDescription: Siemens Molded Case circuit breakers have a long history of excellent performance in both the commercial and industrial market segments; they are tried and true in the most critical applications. Features include field installable external accessories, series connected short circuit ratings, and many sizes for motor circuit protectors & molded case switches.

details: Global Ratings (UL489, CSA, CE, NOM, HID, HACR, SWD)
Many sizes for motor circuit protectors & molded case switches

pageInW3: General Purpose Molded Case Circuit Breakers Sentron Molded Case Circuit Breakers

heading: 3VA Molded Case Circuit Breakers
headline: One system. A variety of applications.
introDescription: Whether in industrial applications or buildings, our new 3VA molded case circuit breaker offers safe, efficient and flexible application options for low-voltage and medium-voltage power distribution. The 3VA range of molded case circuit breakers provides UL frame sizes covering 125A to 600A with the 3VA5 and 3VA6 models, as well as IEC frame sizes covering 100A to 630A with the 3VA1 and 3VA2 models.

section1.name: 3VA6 Molded Case Circuit Breakers - Communications Manual:
Molded Case Circuit Breakers - Cross Reference:

products.name: 3VA5 Molded Case Circuit Breakers
products.description: A thermal-magnetic trip unit is the basic principle for providing overload and short-circuit protection. This line has been designed for economical, cost-efficient installations up to 600A. It is suitable for use in one or three-phase networks, AC networks, and with DC currents.

products.name: 3VA6 Molded Case Circuit Breakers
products.description: The molded case circuit breakers with electronic trip units reliably perform all the tasks required for circuit protection and protection of starter combinations. This series is designed for applications with increased requirements, such as increased interrupting capacity, integrated metering functions or communication capabilities.

heading: VL Molded Case Circuit Breakers
headline: Designed for global requirements utilizing a compact design for a wide range of ratings.
introDescription: VL breaker family offers a compact and modular design to suit a wide range of rating and application. VL family ranges from 150A to 1600A and is available with interchangeable trip units. The VL family also offers Molded Case Switches, Motor Circuit Protector and complete breakers with non-interchangeable trip units.

details: UL, CSA, NOM, IEC, CE and CCC rated breakers
Pick-up and time delay setting do not overlap across frames for easy coordination
Wide range of field installable internal and external accessories
Two groups of accessories cover entire product portfolio
Enclosure is available up to 250A rating

heading: WL Power Circuit Breakers
headline: Siemens WL circuit breakers are available in a style to meet every need
introDescription: If you are looking for lower operating costs, less downtime, and better communication capabilities, and you want to work with fewer parts, in less space, and with more sophisticated capabilities, with the assurance of fit-and forget reliability, then WL Circuit Breakers are your answer. They also provide you with the freedom to make last-minute changes, or take advantage of quick-ship opportunities. All WL Breakers are assembled-to-order and primary-injection tested. They are available with short lead times from our Texas Breaker Plant.

products.name: UL1066 (ANSI)
products.description: Siemens UL1066-Listed WL circuit breakers are available in two frame sizes in both fixed-mount and draw-out configurations in both 3- and 4-pole versions. Designed to meet the demands of UL1558 Low-Voltage Switchgear, they can be applied in UL891, UL845 and UL508 equipment as well. they are available with a wide range of accessories, common across all ratings and frame sizes.

Fusible Switch and Circuit Breaker disconnects are available, along with Tap and Pull box Lug only devices. All Power Mod Main devices feature the Siemens exclusive QuickSystem™ which has been proven to reduce labor by as much as 43% over comparable solutions, while allowing for lower material cost and incredible flexibility.

heading: Rear Connected Switchboards
headline: Siemens rear connected switchboard line suits the requirements of a wide range of applications
introDescription: Siemens  rear connected switchboards are designed, constructed, and tested to provide superior power distribution, power monitoring, and control. These switchboards provide front access for control wiring and rear access for cable connections and bus maintenance.

productDetails.subHeading: Siemens WL breakers can be manually or electrically operated and are available in two versions:
Type RCS switchboards are designed tested and constructed in accordance with:
details: Applicable requirements of National Electric Code (NEC)

heading: Panel Switches
headline: The industry's most trusted safety switches
introDescription: Siemens panelboard switches are available in a wide range of amerages with a variety of twin mounted versions for either group or individual mountings. Our panel switches offer the best in class safety with shunt trip options that can be used when ground fault protection is required. These switches are Siemens engineered with the signature Vacu-Break design that has a long track record of longevity and rugged durability.

heading: Disconnect Switches
headline: The industry's most trusted switches
introDescription: Siemens offers a complete line of disconnect switches ranging from 16-800A to meet just about any commercial or industrial application.  The disconnect portfolio includes offerings that meet UL98 and UL508 Non-fusible standards.

details: Cost effective alternative to UL98 offerings
Two product offerings: Rotary Compact Fusible Switch (CFS), Rugged VBII Visible Blade Fusible and Non-fusible Switches
Wide range of accessories and features for any application

heading: Rear Connected Low Voltage Switchgear
headline: Reliable and safe solution for power distribution systems
introDescription: Reliability and safety are the two most important criteria in the proper functioning of a power distribution system, but both can be compromised if an electrical fault occurs. By integrating the right low voltage switchgear, greater reliability and safer operation can be achieved in the power distribution system.Siemens Type WL low voltage metal-enclosed switchgear is designed, constructed and tested to provide superior power distribution, power monitoring and control.  At the heart of the product is the World Class WL breaker.  The WL breaker has a proven performance track record of proven technology and quality.

section1.name: Not all Low Voltage Switchgear is created equal

details: Best-in-class pre-sales application and post-sales customer support
Modular design for maximum configuration flexibility
Control and communication termination area located in front of equipment and segregated from power cable termination area that is located in rear of equipment
Front accessible vertical and horizontal wiring channels
No heat sinks on breaker or bus
Three levels of horizontal bus through 5000 amps
Breaker racking handle integral to the breaker
All breaker settings and displays clearly visible with breaker door closed
Field installable “drop in place” accessories and trip units
Same accessories work for entire breaker line
Field installable ground fault protection and zone selective interlock
Rogowski coil current sensors provide high metering accuracy and prevent saturation at high current levels

heading: Arc Resistant Low Voltage Switchgear
headline: Added degree of personnel protection with arc resistant low voltage
introDescription: Siemens now offers arc resistant, metal-enclosed, low voltage switchgear solution designed to provide an additional degree of protection for personnel performing normal operating duties in proximity to the energized equipment. Such duties include opening or closing breakers, closed door breaker racking, reading instruments, or other activities that do not require cover removal or opening doors (other than auxiliary/instrument doors).

details: UL listed, performance tested and classified as arc resistant in accordance with ANSI/IEEE C37.20.7-2007
ANSI/IEEE Type 2B accessibility rating to protect personnel at the front, back and sides of the equipment.
Maximum internal arcing short-circuit current: 100kA @ 508V and 85 kA @ 635V

heading: Front Connected Low Voltage Switchgear
headline: Front connection accessibility
introDescription: Front connected low voltage switchgear is designed to have all customer connections (incoming cable lugs, outgoing cable lugs, ground lugs, neutral disconnect, etc.) accessible from the front of the equipment. Additionally, front connected low voltage switchgear requires no rear access and can be mounted directly against a wall. With front connected low voltage switchgear, the rear breaker connection compartment is physically relocated to a separate vertical section beside the vertical section containing the breakers.

details: All customer connections are accessible from the front of the switchgear
Front mounted common breaker plug-in accessories – easy to install
Channel shaped vertical bus that provides superior thermal & short circuit withstand performance
Supports energy management and power quality analysis through advanced breaker metering and relaying capability
Dynamic Arc Flash Sentry (DAS) – dual breaker parameter setting capability

heading: Pak Metering
headline: Ensured ease of handling, easy installation and maximum wall-space efficiency.
introDescription: Siemens PAK Metering devices offer flexibility and easy installation to meet the requirements of multiple position metering projects.

details: Amperes (per Meter position): up to 125A or 200A

headline: Siemens provides a range of meter combination load centers and meter mains  including a line of SOLAR ready meter combination load centers.
introDescription: Meter combination load centers and meter mains that are built for safety, easy installation, long term quality and sustainability.

heading: Low Amperage Busway
headline: Cost-effective low amp power distribution
introDescription: XJ-L HD Busway is the optimal choice for both contractors and users concerned with designing superior electrical systems that require a high plug density and optimal space utilization. The compact design is ideal for limited working areas in computer manufacturing, laboratory or test facilities, schools, hospitals, and machine shops.

productDetails.description: Small cross section for applications where busway routing is constrained
Dual spring clamp assemblies ensure reliable, maintenance-free joints
Plug-in outlets are IP2X finger safe (optional XOC outlet covers increase system to IP40)
Fundamental design has a 60 year history of reliability
Simple snap together installation, maintenance free joints, factory stock of critical components and large distribution inventory of bus plugs ensure quick and easy serviceability
Elbow, tee, crosses, flanged end, and tap boxes are offered in standard and custom configurations
The full range of XJ-L HD bus plugs are interchangeable between 100A, 225A, and 400A busway

heading: Sentron Busway
headline: Cost-effective power delivery solution
introDescription: When you need a cost-effective power delivery solution for an industrial plant, a hospital, shopping mall, or high-tech environment, you face the challenge of balancing performance with value to efficiently distribute power throughout your facility.Siemens Sentron Busway is engineered to ensure the safe and efficient distribution of power in industrial, commercial, and institutional environments worldwide. Thanks to an innovative design, you benefit from labor-saving installation and a flexible, compact bus system that is an ideal fit for most applications. Relative to cable and conduit, that busway can save up to 40% on total installed costs. Additionally, compared to cable and conduit, busway consumes about 50% less space than an equivalent cabled solution.

productDetails.description: Unique tin plating provides excellent conductivity and resists outside elements from attaching to the bars
Compact construction of the Sentron busway conductors allow for a flexibility of configurations
Distributes heat away from the conductors and provides an excellent ground path
Inline filter process and magnetic separator helps to eliminate contaminants common to fluidized bed systems
Optional isolated ground is especially useful in applications where a clean ground is needed
Joint stacks feature a single bolt design and a special, torque indicating, double headed break-off bolt

heading: Lighting Panels
headline: New generation of Lighting Panel products that represents the high level of engineering innovation
introDescription: With flexibility and strength added to the existing rugged and durable panelboard family Siemens panelboards are extremely easy to install. These newer designs also simplify wiring and reduce material requirements saving additional installation time. Siemens also offers unassembled panelboards which are designed to meet shorter lead time requirements, provide product flexibility, and affordable pricing.

section1.name: Selection and Application Guide: P1 Panelboards

details: Lay-in construction and or removable lugs make wiring easier
Panel can be inverted in the field and keep its labeling legible
Field addable sub-fed breakers or Feed-Thru lug kits can be field installed
Unassembled offering is an exact match to Siemens factory built panelboards to provide the same look, quality, and utilize the same components

heading: Fusible Panels
headline: Flexibility and increased safety with fusible panels
introDescription: The Siemens Coordination Panel provides fusible solutions that make it simple and cost effective to selectively coordinate a fused electrical distribution system. It is especially designed to address the NEC Selective Coordination Requirements. Selective coordination is a highly desirable design consideration as selectively coordinated overcurrent protective devices help avoid unnecessary blackouts that negatively affect business assets and productivity.

section1.name: Selection and Application Guide: Coordination Panelboards
Selection and Application Guide: Revised P1 Panelboards

details: The SQSCP is especially designed to address the NEC ® Selective Coordination Requirements for Emergency Legally Required Standby Healthcare Essential Electrical and Critical Operation Power Systems (COPS) per NEC ® 700.28 701.27 645.27 and 708.54.
Flexibility: Field addable sub-fed breakers (up to 250 amps) or feed through lug kits can be field installed without utilizing any of your feeder breaker positions or increasing your box height.
Time efficiency: Spare fuse compartment keeps replacements right at hand.
Increased safety: Finger-safe cube fuses base features a fuse interlock to prevent removing fuse while energized. Optional Surge Protection Device (SPD) can be added as a factory-installed option.

heading: Power Panels
headline: Rugged yet flexible innovative system for your application
introDescription: Siemens Power Panels are ideal for downstream distribution or service entrance equipment in an electrical system. The P4 and P5 Panels offer a wide array of factory-assembled options and have the ability to mix breaker frames in their respective unit space.

details: 1200 amp main circuit breaker or main lugs only maximum
20 amps through 1200 amp branch circuit breakers
Temperature rated or density rated aluminum or copper bus
Fully rated and series rated systems
Symmetrical design does not require unique mountings for top and bottom feed

heading: UPB
headline: Siemens current generation of lighting panel products represent the highest level of engineering innovation and features
introDescription: Siemens family of lighting panelboards have always been rugged and durable.  With new innovative features and Breaker types being introduced, the P1-P2-P3 family of factory assembled lighting panels are even more flexible and easier to install. These newer designs also simplify wiring and reduce material requirements, saving additional installation time. Siemens also offers P1 unassembled lighting panels (UPB program), through our authorized distributors, which are designed to meet shorter lead time requirements, provide product flexibility and affordable pricing.

productDetails.description: The Siemens P1 UPB program (Unassembled Panelboard Program) is for Authorized Siemens UPB distributors only.
details: P1 UPB lighting panels are available in 250A and 400A max. configurations.
BL/BQD branch breakers are available from 15A to 100A
xGB branch breakers are available from 15A to 125A
SPD devices can be ordered for field installation in subfeed space.
P1 UPB panels have all the same field installable kits available as for factory assembled but are limited in circuits and only available for the most popular system voltages.
P1 250A UPB circuits: 18, 30, 42 and 54 only. (no 66 cir.)
P1 400A UPB circuits: 30, 42 and 54 only. (no 66 cir.)

productDetails.subHeading: All UPB Panels include subfeed space (all are FT, no NFT)
productDetails.description: Limited system voltages available:
details: >> BL/BQD type or GB type of breakers cannot be mixed in the same panel.

heading: Talon Meter Mounting Equipment
headline: Market leader in innovation and value for the meter socket industry
introDescription: From our award-winning lever bypass products to proprietary K base products to innovative temporary power design, Talon is the long-term solution partner for your metering needs.

productDetails.description: Talon offers single position metering, temporary power panels, PAK metering, enclosed receptables, AC disconnets,  CT cabonets, transformer rated, and meter combo & mains.

heading: SEM3 Branch Circuit Meters and Accessories
headline: Modular metering solutions for energy monitoring, data analysis, and sub billing applications.
introDescription: The Embedded Micro Metering Module (SEM3) is a modular metering solution for energy monitoring, data analysis, and sub billing applications.  The SEM3 is pre-engineered to integrate into Siemens Panelboards, Switchboards, PDU, RPP, and Bus Plugs but is also offered for retrofit applications.

section1.name: Sentron 3/6 Bus Plug with Metering Literature
What's New in Bus Plug 3/6 with Metering

details: Converts single meter modules into 1, 2 and 3 phase meters
Provides a single Modbus slave address for entire panel
Supplies Class signals to Meter Modules representing A, B, C and N voltage levels
Can measure accurately down to 1% of maximum amperage range
Rated for use on non-insulated conductors
Optional  up to 44 Digital Pulse inputs for monitoring Water & Gas
Available as either High Accuracy (0.2%) or Standard Accuracy (1%)
Modbus RTU communications to the controller
Available for 3, 6, 9, 15 and 21 metered branches per side
Addresses for Meter Module to Controller communications are hard coded into Meter Racks
9, 15 and 21 Meter Racks have easy dip switch for fast configuration
3, 6 Meter Rack has a rotary switch for multiple ranges; can be daisy chained to other Meter Racks

productDetails.subHeading: The SEM3 system is made up of the following components and options:
details: Controller – The controller is used to communicate the metered values to outside systems by way of a web page interface, Modbus RTU or Modbus TCP. One controller can manage up to 45 meter modules. The controller also has the system digital inputs for receiving pulse inputs from other metering devices as well as a digital output for the combined KWh output of the system being metered.

Meter Modules – There are two choices for the meter modules that are differentiated by accuracy specification. The accuracies are 1% for the standard accuracy modules and 0.2% for the high accuracy modules. The accuracy is tested in accordance to ANSI C12.20/0.2.
Meter Racks – The meter modules are designed to snap into the rack assemblies. The rack assemblies are sized by how many modules will fit into each and come in 3, 9, 15 and 21 module configurations.

CTs or Current Transformers – The SEM3 systems has solid core CTs and split core CT's for use with the system in the following maximum amperage ranges 50, 125, 250, 400, 600, 800 and 1200 amps. These are maximum amperage ranges for normal usage but will measure accurately down to 1% of the maximum range.

Communication cables – The communication cables are designed like CAT 5 cables but are insulated for use in systems up to 600 volts. The cables are for two way communication from the controller to the rack/meter modules.

heading: Power/Power Quality Meters and Accessories
headline: Power and Power quality metering solutions for critical power environments as well as basic metering and energy monitoring.
introDescription: Power Quality meters are suited to local and remote monitoring of electrical installations with the capability to analyze and isolate the source of power quality problems. The powerful compact power monitoring meter (PAC3100, PAC3200, PAC4200) may be used as a stand alone device monitory over 25/50/200 parameters or as part of an industrial control, building automation or global power monitoring system.

The WinPM.net solution offers comprehensive power quality and reliability analysis and allows you to manage intelligent metering and protective device.  While PowerManager, combined with Siemens power meters and low voltage protective devices allows you to measure as well as process, analyze, and store information.

heading: Digital Solutions and Services
headline: Power Distribution Solutions (PDS) Energy Management - Engineering Services can design a power quality and monitoring system for you.
introDescription: A Siemens designed solution using WinPM.Net or Powermanager helping to analyze, identify and correct power issues before they become critical.  And,  coupled with high quality Siemens meters will result in a powerful tool.

details: Integration of other utilities like gas, water, steam, air and more
Third party hardware and software Integration
On-site and remote hands-on system training

heading: Low Voltage Transformers
headline: Flexible converting of voltages for your application
introDescription: While being a completely static electrical device, dry type Low Voltage Distribution Transformers are versatile to benefit your application. They convert alternating current from one voltage level to another to match the voltage supply to the electrical load. By increasing (step-up) or decreasing (step-down) voltages, the transformers versatile electrical distribution for general purpose, lighting and power loads in commercial and industrial applications.Since no vaults are required for installation, dry type transformers can be located right at the load to provide correct voltage for the application. This eliminates the need for long, costly, low voltage feeders.

section1.name: Low Voltage Transformers with DOE 2016 updates

details: Designed to ANSI and NEMA Standards
Available in a wide variety of ratings
For general purpose, lighting and power loads in commercial and industrial applications
Dry type transformers air cooled by natural convection
Meets the demands of AC and DC variable speed drives
Horsepower rating and voltage changes for motor drive systems
Cores designed with reduced flux density for drive applications

heading: Surge Protection Devices
headline: High quality surge protection for your custom application
introDescription: Siemens is committed to providing high quality surge protective devices for application in residential, commercial, and industrial electrical systems. Our Transient Protection System (TPS) and FirstSurge families of surge protective devices ensure the highest possible electrical system safety, protection, and reliability, while delivering some of the industry's best performance ratings.

productDetails.description: Siemens FirstSurge™ stops power surges from entering your electrical system protecting smart appliances, TVs, computers, heating and cooling systems and more. Every FirstSurge™ includes commercial class notifiers (LEDs, Audible Alarm, and Red Flashing LED) and supplemental GRM Diagnostics.
details: UL 1449 Listed, Type 2, Surge Protective Device (SPD)
Rated for 120/240 split phase panels up to 400A
Surge Current Capacities: 60,000 A,  100,000 A, 140,000 A
Installs onto any brand load center

productDetails.description: Our FirstSurge line of residential surge products offers commercial class protection for the whole house. When a replacement becomes necessary, FirstSurge is equipped with 3-stage diagnostics to properly notify homeowners. The balanced protection and robustness of our FirstSurge units provide assurance to homeowners that their modern homes and appliances are fully protected. Siemens' FirstSurge devices are designed to stop surges before they enter in order to prevent that damage from happening and protect the whole house.

Siemens' line of factory installed internal and external TPS3 SPDs (switchgear, switchboards, panelboards, MCCs, busway and more) consistently assures optimal performance through direct bus bar connections or minimal cable connections. This translates to some of the industry's best installed voltage protection ratings (VPRs) and surge current capacities ranging from 100kA to 1000kA.

heading: Residential Circuit Breakers
headline: Protecting your home's electrical system
introDescription: Siemens offers a wide array of thermal-magnetic circuit breakers that are the key element for overload and short-circuit protection of your home’s electrical system. To provide additional protection Siemens offers circuit breakers to protect against severe electrical shock or electrocution, mitigate the risk of electrical fires, and protect against damaging surges and voltage spikes.

section1.name: 1 & 2 Pole Combination Type Arc-Fault Circuit Interrupters

details: Industry exclusive LED indicators (Residential Arc Fault Circuit Interrupting breakers)
Residential Ground Fault Circuit Interrupting breakers - Resists false tripping (shielded to prevent RF interference)
Residential Surge Protection Circuit breakers - Easy to install and perfect for retrofit
Residential Dual-Function Circuit breakers - Cost and installation time savings in one device
All residential circuit breakers - Insta-Wire feature

pageInW3: Residential AFCI Circuit Breakers Residential GFCI Circuit Breakers Residential Dual-Function Circuit Breakers (AFCI & GFCI) Residential Main Breakers Surge Protection Breakers Residential Thermal Mag Circuit Breakers

heading: Residential Load Centers
headline: Highest quality and the most complete offering on the market
introDescription: Siemens has a high quality and feature-rich line of Single Phase, 3-Phase, Specialty and Temporary Power Load Center products to meet applications for virtually every need. Siemens custom built load centers provide maximum flexibility in combination with labor saving features to aid the contractor while installing the product. Featuring the patented Insta-wire neutral/ground system, convertibility, copper bussing, and mounting tabs on the trim - all features that were specifically engineered by Siemens to decrease installation time & increase flexibility.

details.key: Combination Surface or Flush Trim or Surface only Trim
details.value: all included with every load center
Copper bussing available, Main Lug and Main Breaker
Type QP, QT, QAF, QPF, QE, QN, QNR

pageInW3: Single Phase Load Centers 3-Phase Load Centers Specialty Load Centers, Structured Wiring, Temporary Power

heading: Control Circuit Components
headline: Additional protection with a branch circuit protection device
introDescription: Siemens circuit protection devices are engineered to allow for easy deployment, quick installation and secure protection of industrial devices from excessive current flow. Siemens low voltage circuit protection devices such as miniature circuit breakers, supplementary protectors, and fuse holders, range in performance and style to meet wide-ranging needs.

products.name: Miniature Circuit Breakers IEC
products.description: Suitable for Reverse Feed Connections, miniature circuit breakers IEC feature touch protection to EN 50274, visible indicator for ON and OFF/trip, and DIN rail mounting (35 mm). Smaller Size than traditional MCCBs, breakers include provide identical wire screw connections on line and load sides. The product line is available with a range of busbar & busbar accesories (UL recognized to file E321559).

productDetails.subHeading: Trip Characteristics B, C & D (EN 60 898, UL 1077)

products.name: Terminal Blocks
products.description: Siemens terminal blocks with Screw, Spring Loaded and Insulation Displacement Connections meet or exceed the requirements of CSA, IEC, NEMA, UL, VDE and other international Standards.

products.name: Supplementary Protectors
products.description: Designed to provide additional protection along with a branch circuit pretection device, supplementary protectors are easy to install with no tool required for mounting or discmounting, have high ranked breaking capacity of up to 14,000A, and include identical terminals at both sides for an optional infeed from the top or the bottom.

productDetails.description: Supplementary protectors are equipped with a delayed overload/time-dependent thermal release (thermal bimetal) for low overcurrents and with an instantaneous electromagnetic release for high overload and short-circuit currents.  The thermal trip point on all versions is 1.13 to 1.45 times the supplementary protector rating.

details.value: To protect very sensitive circuits such as semiconductors. Magnetic trip point - 2 to 3 times supplementary protector rating.
For European residential circuit protection.  Also for protection of computers and electronic equipment. Magnetic trip point. - 3 to 5 times supplementary protector rating.
For general device protection in control circuits and all other supplementary circuit protection systems. Magnetic trip point - 5 to10 times supplementary protector rating.
For protection of high inrush loads. Magnetic trip point - 10 to 20 times supplementary protector rating.

products.name: Fuse and fuse holders
products.description: Engineered for easy insertion and removal of cyndrical type fuses, all fuse holders are equipped with a fuse handle or draw mechanism. Standard features offer multi-pole configurations, standard 35 mnn (DIN rail mountings, finger sage design, and with/without blown fuse indicator. All fuse holders are equipped with either a fuse handle or draw mechanism for easy insertion and removal of cylindrical type fuses. During insertion and removal the fuses are isolated from the power/control circuit. Their compact size requires less space than typical open-type fuse holders and they mount directly onto standard 35 mm mounting rails. Fuse holders for 8mm x 32 mm, 10 mm x 38 mm fuses in the 1 + N draw design occupy the same mounting space as 1 pole designs. This unique design saves space when compared to the typical handle type fuse holder which requires two poles.

pageInW3: Miniature Circuit Breakers IEC Terminal Blocks Supplementary Protectors Fuses and Fuse Holders

heading: Medium-Voltage Circuit Breakers
headline: Reliable technology, ease of operation and economy with Siemens medium-voltage circuit breakes
introDescription: Be it energy supply corporations, industry or power stations, any owner or user of primary distribution systems for medium voltage puts high demands on the switchgear. These include reliable technology, ease of operation and economy. With our complete range of circuit breaker and switchgear systems for medium-voltage, Siemens sets the standards when it comes to reliable and efficient solutions for special requirements.

heading: Medium-Voltage Motor Controllers
headline: Siemens has provided medium-voltage controllers to users in the U.S., Canada, and around the world for construction, industrial, and utility projects for over 50 years.
introDescription: The Siemens SIMOVAC™ medium-voltage non-arc-resistant and SIMOVAC-AR™ arc-resistant controllers have a modular design incorporating up to two 12SVC400 (400 A) controllers, housed in a freestanding sheet steel enclosure. Each controller is UL 347 class E2, equipped with three current-limiting fuses, a non-load-break isolating switch, and a fixed-mounted vacuum contactor (plug-in type optional for 12SVC400). The enclosure is designed for front access, allowing the equipment to be located with the rear of the equipment close to a non-combustible wall.Siemens Integrated Electric-Racking System (SIERS) is optionally available with type SIMOVAC non-arc-resistant and SIMOVAC-AR arc-resistant controllers.

section1.name: Flyer - SIMOVAC-RVAT and SIMOVAC-RVAT-AR reduced-voltage, autotransformer controllers
Flyer - SIMOVAC-SSRVS non-arc-resistant and SIMOVAC-SSRVS-AR arc-resistant solid-state reduced-voltage controller
Flyer - SIERS integrated electrical-racking system for controllers
Flyer - SIERS integrated electrical racking system family for medium-voltage air-insulated switchgear, medium-voltage motor controllers, and low-voltage motor control centers
Flyer - Sm@rtGear portfolio - Revolutionary intelligent platform for configuration, control and automation
Flyer - Direct purchase program for OEM customers for motor controllers

Brochure - Siemens intelligent sync transfer minimizes cost while maximizing performance

Instruction manual - SIMOVAC non-arc-resistant and SIMOVAC-AR arc-resistant medium-voltage controllers
Instruction manual - SIMOVAC-SSRVS non-arc-resistant and SIMOVAC-SSRVS-AR arc-resistant solid-state reduced-voltage controller

details: Squirrel-cage induction motors (non-reversing, reversing, multi-speed or soft start)
SIMOVAC-AR tested for arc-resistance to IEEE C37.20.7, type 2B
Complies with UL 347 6th edition (same as CSA C22.2 No. 253-09) (UL / cUL Listing not available on 720 A SSRVS controller)
400 A bolt-in or stab-in (optional) or 720 A bolt-in vacuum contactor
400 A or 720 A non-load-break isolation switch
2.4 kV, 4.16 kV and 6.9 kV (up to 7.65 kV) system voltage ratings
1,200 A, 2,000 A, 3,000 A or 4,000 A main bus with standard epoxy insulation on bus bars, and with optional boots for insulating joints
Main bus and ground bus are supported and braced to 63 kA two-second short-time capability
Top-mounted pressure relief channel shipped installed for reduced site installation time
Isolation switch with visible indication through viewing window to verify that the power cell is isolated from line-side source ‒ no need to open panel door
Isolation switch mechanically interlocked with the access door to prevent user access to primary compartment when isolation switch is closed
Low-voltage compartment is isolated from the medium-voltage compartment
All components are front accessible, facilitating routine inspection or parts replacement
Current-limiting fuses, contactor assembly and isolating switch assembly are easily removed from the enclosure
The main bus compartment is top, side and front accessible for easy installation and extension.
